intro: Machaerium riparium, commonly known as river machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows near water bodies, showcasing its preference for moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of white or pale yellow. Machaerium riparium plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
